description.en: This course introduces the participants to some of the main theories in the interdisciplinary fields of social memory and cultural heritage. The processes of creating cultural heritage and memory are explored at international, national, local, communal and individual levels as well as at their intersections, drawing on a range of examples from museums, heritage and memory sites. Students are acquainted with methods for studying heritage fields and learn to apply them in case studies. Thematic foci, approaches and case studies explored vary from year to year.
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate valitud teooriatest sotsiaalse mälu ja kultuuripärandi uurimise interdistsiplinaarses vallas. Muuseume, kultuuripärandi ja mälupaikade mitmekülgsete näidete varal käsitletakse kultuuripärandi ja mälu loomise protsesse rahvusvahelisel, rahvuslikul, kogukondlikul ja indiviidi tasandil ning nende lõikepunktides. Õppijad tutvuvad valitud meetoditega ja harjutavad nende kasutamist juhtumianalüüsides. Käsitletavate teemade, lähenemisviiside ja näidete valik varieerub aastate lõikes.

objectives.en: Drawing on examples from museums in particular, this course aims
objectives.et: Muuseume fookusesse võttev kursus seab eesmärgiks:

objectives.en: * to familiarise students with some of the main theories, sources, and methods in the interdisciplinary and overlapping fields of social memory and cultural heritage;
objectives.et: * tutvustada õppijatele peamisi teooriaid, allikaid ja meetodeid sotsiaalse mälu ja kultuuripärandi interdistsiplinaarses uurimises;

objectives.en: * to provide students with tools for critically analysing processes whereby selected tangible and intangible phenomena are turned into cultural heritage or denied this status in diverse settings ranging from autobiographies and families to nation-states and the international arena.
objectives.et: * õpetada kriitiliselt analüüsima protsesse, mille vahendusel nähtustele omistatakse või keelatakse vaimse või ainelise kultuuripärandi staatus.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, students
* describe the main approaches in the fields of cultural heritage and social memory;
learning_outcomes.et: * kirjeldada peamisi lähenemisi kultuuripärandi ja sotsiaalse mälu uurimise vallas;

learning_outcomes.en: * apply these approaches to empirical case studies;
* explain the role and potential of museums and cultural heritage in contemporary diverse and complex societies.
learning_outcomes.et: * selgitada muuseumide ja kultuuripärandi rolli tänapäeva kultuuriliselt mitmekesistes ja komplekssetes ühiskondades .

grade_evaluation.et: All assignments have to be submitted.

A.et: Written work is very thorough, the topics are contextualised with the aid of all the course material and other relevant material. It contains author's original ideas and assesments. Group presentation shows clever collaboration.

B.et: Written work is thorough, the topics are more or less contextualised with the aid of all the course material and other relevant material. It contains author's opinions. Group presentation shows efforts of collaboration.

C.et: Written work fills all he requirements and reference additional material apart for what is assigned for a specific topic. The presentation contains individual work, but no collaboration in the group.

D.et: Assignments fill all the minimal requirements (length, style, contents), but show no signs of looking for information apart from what is mandatory for a specific topic.

E.et: Assignments fill most of the minimum criteria of each assignment and does not contain plagiarism.

F.et: Inadequate (style, contents, length) or contains plagiarism.
